intro: Deppea umbellata, commonly known as the Umbellate Deppea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clustered, small white or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
